page.title: 15LEGEND - ERSKINE
page.content:
According to the{legend}the name {ERSKINE}stems from an incident during one of the Danish raids on the country. The head of a Danish general was held aloft on a knife during the battle with the cry of{'ERIS KYNE',}or {'head on a knife'.}The king granted the surname of{'ERISKYNE'}to the warrior and the lands and castle of {ERISKYNE}probably gave their name to the Church and the whole district annexed to it.
A more{practical}explanation is that it stems from the{Gaelic 'IR ISGYN',}a green place or rising ground, which is an apt description of the terrain of the parish.
